definition: to show forth/to appear as a vivid image/to stand out markedly
to appear vividly on paper (idiom); to show forth vividly (in writing, painting etc)/to stand out markedly

sentences.english: It is evident in the people and the culture.
sentences.chinese: 它還躍然於民衆和文化之間。

sentences.english: Though it is shorter than I hope, the love to our Motherland is vividly displayed on the paper.
sentences.chinese: 儘管短了一些，但是其中對祖國熱愛之情躍然紙上。

sentences.english: Click the Red, a stream of bleak vividly ink heart.
sentences.chinese: 輕點紅塵，一溪墨色的淒涼躍然心間。

sentences.english: As they watch the ladies, they scribble on paper.
sentences.chinese: 在看客的觀賞間，美麗的女士躍然紙上。

sentences.english: In the temples of India and Japan, the tales of Asia came to life.
sentences.chinese: 而在印度及日本的寺廟裏，亞洲的童話故事躍然眼前。

sentences.english: When it's scanned, numbers and letters pop up on the scanner.
sentences.chinese: 當對它進行掃描時，數字和字母躍然於屏幕上。

sentences.english: His personality comes through with in his writing.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格躍然顯現於他年寫的文章中。

sentences.english: The banner headline leaped out at me from the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 報紙上的通欄標題躍然映入我的眼簾。

sentences.english: The answer presented itself when I looked at the problem again.
sentences.chinese: 那問題我又看了一遍，答案便躍然眼前。
